interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Mystery Science Theater 3000 - Mitchell
Review Date: 2012/02/05
Store: Ashby, John  (Actor),     Baker, Joe Don  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy
Product Description: ['Rare Mystery Science theater 3000 episode where Joel and the bots riff on the awful film "Mitchell" starring Joe Don Baker']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '8 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 20, 2001', 'Actors': 'Ashby, John, Baker, Joe Don, Balsam, Martin, Barnes, Rayford, Bass, Todd', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Studio': 'Rhino Theatrical', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: It's obvious  that "Mitchell" was a copy of the Shaft movie and short-lived television series: his own man; rebel within law enforcement while sticking it to the man;sex machine (sort of); and willing to take changes regardless of the odds. BUT the cast of MST3000 rip it to shreds.  With the exception of Gypsy (extremely annoying), the cast has some good one liners: "Mr Treveno has been hit again" ; "he just landed just short of the green"; "fresh panties all around"; and  Tom Servo's obsession with Joe Don Baker's eating/farting. One of the best!!!
Review Title: Yes One of the Best
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

It's obvious  that "Mitchell" was a copy of the Shaft movie and short-lived television series: his own man; rebel within law enforcement while sticking it to the man;sex machine (sort of); and willing to take changes regardless of the odds. BUT the cast of MST3000 rip it to shreds.  With the exception of Gypsy (extremely annoying), the cast has some good one liners: "Mr Treveno has been hit again" ; "he just landed just short of the green"; "fresh panties all around"; and  Tom Servo's obsession with Joe Don Baker's eating/farting. One of the best!!!
Yes One of the Best
profile:
**User Preferences Summary:**

- **Genres:** Strong preference for comedy within science fiction and fantasy, particularly through a nostalgic lens of classic television and film.
- **Entertainment Style:** Enjoys humor derived from satire and commentary on films, as evidenced by appreciation for the unique format of riffing on poor-quality movies.
- **Content Appreciation:** Values clever one-liners and comedic interactions among characters, indicating a preference for dialogue-driven humor.
- **Media Format:** Prefers physical media, specifically DVDs, suggesting an appreciation for collecting or enjoying tangible formats over digital.
- **Community Engagement:** Engages in discussions or reviews about films, indicating a desire to share opinions and connect with others who have similar tastes. 
- **Specific Interests:** Shows interest in cult classic films and programs, especially those that offer ironic or parody-driven content.

Overall, this user exemplifies a passionate fan of comedic science fiction with an affinity for interactive commentary styles and nostalgia for classic media.
